page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: {HOUSING Beech Hill village is in this area. Here the newer houses are to be found - built in 1950s. { Beech Hill House} is very elegant in design ,it has been turned into flats. The other houses are either Victorian in style or Georgian. In other words, with flat faced walls, coloured lightish brown and square windows and huge gardens . There are some Tudor houses in the area, with wooden beams on the outside, filled in with red bricks. They are very large,and inside are large oak beams. There are some pensioners houses in the area. The oldest building in the area, which is still lived in, was built in the 16th century. But the oldest remains of a building is the old Priory, dating from the 13th century. {
